AlarmStorageReader.ContinueReading (METH)
AlarmStorageReader.ContinueReading (METH)
Â¶
METHOD ContinueReading :
EAlarmStorageReaderErrors
Reads data from the alarm storage.
InOut:
Scope
Name
Type
Comment
Return
ContinueReading
EAlarmStorageReaderErrors
A EAlarmStorageReaderErrors value indicating, whether the processing has been completed successfully or not:
EAlarmStorageReaderErrors.NoError: Completed successfully
EAlarmStorageReaderErrors.InvalidCall: ContinueReading was called without calling method Read before
EAlarmStorageReaderErrors.AdditionalReadCallRequired: Reading has been completed successfully, but there is
additional call of method ContinueReading necessary to read the rest of the data
Input
liTimstampFrom
LINT
The timestamp (when the alarm became active) of the 1st
alarm
liTimstampTo
LINT
The timestamp of the last alarm
xReadAscending
BOOL
If this parameter is TRUE, then the rows will be returned by âtimestamp activeâ ascending,
otherwise descending
itfAlarmStorageReaderConsumer
IAlarmStorageReaderConsumer
An instance of IAlarmStorageReaderConsumer, to which the data read from
the alarm storage will be passed.

rows.Name: ContinueReading
rows.Comment: A EAlarmStorageReaderErrors value indicating, whether the processing has been completed successfully or not:EAlarmStorageReaderErrors.NoError: Completed successfullyEAlarmStorageReaderErrors.InvalidCall: ContinueReading was called without calling method Read beforeEAlarmStorageReaderErrors.AdditionalReadCallRequired: Reading has been completed successfully, but there isadditional call of method ContinueReading necessary to read the rest of the data

rows.Name: liTimstampFrom
rows.Comment:
The timestamp (when the alarm became active) of the 1st
alarm

rows: The timestamp of the last alarm

If this parameter is TRUE, then the rows will be returned by âtimestamp activeâ ascending,
otherwise descending

An instance of IAlarmStorageReaderConsumer, to which the data read from
the alarm storage will be passed.
